intro: Crotalaria gamwelliae, commonly known as the Gamwell's cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets. Crotalaria gamwelliae is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments.
